 Most investment accounts and savings accounts you put money in will earn you what is called "compound interest". When you put money into a compound interest bearing account, your principal (i.e., the money you put in yourself) will earn interest at a certain rate over time. What makes a compound interest bearing account unique, however, is that the interest you earn, if you reinvest it (e.g., leave it in your account), will generate interest along with your principal.
57.context_after: Additionally, you can maximize the benefits of your compound interest bearing account by investing early and often, by putting as much money in the account as possible, and by being patient.

100.sentence_1: The homestead exemption in Florida can save you hundreds of dollars in property taxes.
100.sentence_2: The homestead exemption in Florida can save you hundreds of dollars in property taxes <for permanent Florida residents>.
100.context_after: If you qualify, you can reduce the assessed value of your homestead up to $50,000. To apply, gather required documents and complete an application at your county appraiser’s office. Senior citizens and members of the military may also qualify for additional exemptions.

101.sentence_1: Address the letter to the director of claims.
101.sentence_2: Address the letter to the director of claims, <unless otherwise directed>.
101.context_before:
You will need the name and complete address of your insurance provider. 
     * Make sure you know your insurance policy number, admission and discharge dates, and the exact amount of charges you are claiming. 
 2.
101.context_after: Note in the first paragraph of the letter your medical provider's name and the date the services in question were rendered.  3. Begin the second paragraph by explaining that you do not feel the denial of the claim was justified and then give a thorough explanation arguing your case. Explain that you are appealing the decision.     * Request the credentials of the person who reviewed and ultimately made the decision to deny your claim.

102.sentence_1: You can be charged as an accessory if you aid or abet your family member in any way.
102.sentence_2: You can be charged as an accessory if you aid or abet your family member <with an active warrant> in any way.
102.context_before:
## Timestamp::::2016-08-04T16:27:44Z
 
 An “accessory after the fact” is someone who helps a criminal hide from police.
102.context_after: To avoid illegally helping your family member, you should cut off contact and work with the police. The best thing you can do for your family member is to help them get a qualified criminal defense attorney.

103.sentence_1: Make the typeface slightly larger so that the title stands out.
103.sentence_2: Make the typeface slightly larger <than the rest of the text> so that the title stands out.
103.context_before: Title the document. The title you give will depend on whether you are drafting a “limited” or a “full” warranty. Regardless of the title, make sure to put the title at the top of the page, centered between the left- and right-hand margins.
103.context_after: * A full warranty: Make sure your title contains the words “full warranty” as well as the period of coverage and a description of what parts or problems are covered. For example, “Full Two-Year Warranty on the Glass Liner of the Amesbury Water Heater.”     * A limited warranty: Simply use the words “Limited Warranty.” Don’t include other information, such as the duration, as the reader might assume the limitation only applies to the duration and not other aspects of the warranty.

104.sentence_1: To be safest, just assume that everything you bring is going to get wet.
104.sentence_2: To be safest <as you pack>, just assume that everything you bring is going to get wet.
104.context_before: At the very least, aim to drink 16oz or more of water in the hour leading up to your swim. Stuff phones, electronics, and valuables in resealable plastic bags.
104.context_after: If you are taking things like your mobile phone that can't get wet, take them in a separate small bag, pockets of your clothes or a waterproof bag which you can put in your swimming bag.

105.sentence_1: Others only consider a customer lost when the client formally submits a request to close the account.
105.sentence_2: Others only consider a customer lost when the client formally submits a request to close the account, <such as a subscription>.
105.context_before:
## Steps
 
 1. Establish what the company standard is for qualifying a client account as active or lost. Many companies consider any account that shows zero activity for a specified period of time to be lost.
105.context_after: Setting this criterion will make it easier to gather the data necessary for determining the current rate of client churn.  2. Identify the total number of active customers carried on the company's client list as of a specific date, such as the last day of the most recently closed business quarter. That date will serve as the standard to determine what type of growth or loss has occurred from that date to the day that the churn rate calculation is made.   3. Determine the number of new customers that have been added to the client base during the current period.

106.sentence_1: However, there may be exceptions to these basic age requirements.
106.sentence_2: However, there may be exceptions to these basic age requirements, <such as if you are legally emancipated>.
106.context_before: 4. Check age requirements. Many states and countries do not provide unemployment benefits to anyone under 18, or anyone old enough to legally retire.
106.context_after: * Some countries have different maximum benefit amounts available depending on your age. For example, if you are unemployed in the UK you are eligible for up to £57.90 per week if you are 24 years of age or younger. If you're 25 or older, you may get up to £73.10 per week.

107.sentence_1: Typically, you can file your lawsuit in your local small claims court.
107.sentence_2: Typically, you can file your lawsuit in your local small claims court <depending on how much you are owed>.
107.context_before: Sue your landlord. Whether you move out or not, you might be able to sue your landlord for violating the implied warranty of habitability. In your lawsuit, you will argue that the house wasn’t worth what you paid for it in rent, and you ask the judge to reimburse you for the difference.
107.context_after: * Small claims court is set up for people to represent themselves without a lawyer. They should have fill-in-the-blank forms, which makes filing your lawsuit easier. File your forms with the court clerk.     *

108.sentence_1: You also need to contribute a matching portion yourself.
108.sentence_2: You also need to contribute a matching portion yourself <as the employer>.
108.context_before: 3. Estimate the amount of Social Security and Medicare taxes. You need to withhold and deposit taxes for both Social Security and Medicare, which are collectively called “FICA” taxes.
108.context_after: See Publication 15 for how to calculate the amount.    * As of 2017, the Social Security tax rate is 6.2% for both the employer and employee. This tax is applied only to the first $127,200 of wages. For example, if your employee makes 500 a week, then you will withhold a total of 12.4%.
